```{r eval=FALSE, echo=FALSE}

# Run `scopus_search` as many times as necessary based on the number of results, 
# limited to limit of results per search allowed by my API quota (normally, 20).

library(dplyr)
library(rscopus)

query = '("lme4" or "lmerTest" or "brms") AND maximal AND "random slopes" AND (convergence OR converge OR converged OR converging)'

my_quota = 20

res = scopus_search(query = query, max_count = my_quota, count = my_quota)

safe_maximum = 5000  # protection from massive search

total_results = 0 : res$total_results

chunks = total_results[seq(1, length(total_results), my_quota)]

results = data.frame(author = as.character(), date = as.character(), 
                     title = as.character(), publication = as.character(), 
                     doi = as.character())

if(have_api_key()) { # previously registered my key using `set_api_key()`
  
  for(i in 1:n_distinct(chunks)) {
    
    res = scopus_search(query = query, max_count = 20, 
                        count = 20, start = chunks[i])
    
    for(i in 1:length(res$entries)) {
      
      author = res$entries[[i]]$`dc:creator`
      date = res$entries[[i]]$`prism:coverDisplayDate`
      title = res$entries[[i]]$`dc:title`
      publication = res$entries[[i]]$`prism:publicationName`
      doi = res$entries[[i]]$`prism:doi`
      
      i_results = data.frame( ifelse(!is.null(author), author, NA), 
                              ifelse(!is.null(date), date, NA), 
                              ifelse(!is.null(title), title, NA), 
                              ifelse(!is.null(publication), publication, NA), 
                              ifelse(!is.null(doi), doi, NA) )
    }
    
    results = rbind(results, i_results)
  }
}

```
